document.docTitle: Anelytra (Anelytra) medicavia Yang & Bian 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New additions to the Chinese Anelytra Redtenbacher, 1891 (Tettigoniidae: Conocephalinae; Agraeciini)

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURE 2. Anelytra (Anelytra) medicavia Yang & Bian sp. nov. Male: A–B. head in frontal view; C. fastigium verticis in dorsal view; D–E. head, thoraces and tegmina: D. dorsal view, E. lateral view; F–J. apex of abdomen: F. dorso-lateral view, G. dorso-lateral and slightly apical view, H. apico-dorsal view, I. lateral view, J. dorsal view; K. left cercus in dorsal view; L–M. subgenital plate: L. ventral view, M. ventro-apical view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male. Body medium. Fastigium verticis conical, robust and short, projecting forward, apex obtusely rounded. Face subrugose with numerous impressed dots ( Fig. 2A–B ). Eyes globular, protruding.

TABLE 1. Annotation of the mitochondrial genomes of

sp. nov.
and
Anelytra ( Anelytra ) multicurvus

subSubSection.paragraph: Notes: J and N refer to the majority and minority strand, respectively. Position numbers refer to positions on the majority strand

head in frontal view; C. fastigium verticis in dorsal view; D–E. head, thoraces and tegmina: D. dorsal view, E. lateral view; F–J. apex of abdomen: F. dorso-lateral view, G. dorso-lateral and slightly apical view, H. apico-dorsal view, I. lateral view, J. dorsal view; K. left cercus in dorsal view; L–M. subgenital plate: L. ventral view, M. ventro-apical view.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype : male, Sanjiangkou , Mengnuo , Longling , Yunnan , Alt.
615 m
( 24.41N , 99.02E ),
June 3, 2020
, coll. by Zizhong Yang and Yunchuan Yang; DUIER .

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The new species name is from Latin “ med ” and “ cav ” referring to the male cerci, concave in the middle.

Discussion. The new species is very similar to
Anelytra ( Anelytra ) curvata Ingrisch, 1998
,
A. ( Anelytra ) curvata Ingrisch, 1998
,
A. ( Anelytra ) elongata Ingrisch, 1998
A. ( Anelytra ) semicurvata Gorochov, 2020
and
A. ( Anelytra ) forceps
Gorochov, 2020
in male cerci, but differs from them in: face black ( Fig. 2A ); posterior margin of male tenth abdominal tergite triangular directing downwards, which split along the midline ( Fig. 2F, I ); male cerci short and right-angular curved inwards, middle area concave on dorsal margin ( Fig. 2K ); male subgenital plate long, and curved upwards, the subapical area narrowed, apical part widened ( Fig. 2L–M ).
